feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 12:04PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 21 at 3:56PM MST until August 21 at 4:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 355 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Star Valley, or 7 miles southeast of Payson, moving south at 5 to 10 mph.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 3:49PM MST until August 21 at 6:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 344 PM MST, Over 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the local drainages and upstream. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the area, particularly within Tappan Wash and Cedar Wash.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 3:43PM MST until August 21 at 6:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR THE MARBLE CANYON AREA SOUTH OF LEES FERRY... At 341 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen, and light to moderate rainfall will continue for the next hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.summary: ...A several strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Coconino County and eastern Yavapai County through 415 PM MST... At 335 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Munds Park, or near Sedona, moving south at 10 to 15 mph near I-17 and Highway 89A. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 21 at 9:05AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 9:40AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR CONNECTICUT... Due to moderate to severe drought conditions, ground fuels and soil moisture are very dry. This has lead to an increased potential for the development and spread of brush fires today.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including Franklin County. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 2:35PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Thunderstorm chances will increase over southeast Washington late tonight into Monday. This will carry the potential for abundant lightning with limited moisture. This will increase the potential for fire starts. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE WAZ709...

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 2:24PM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area tonight is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms overnight becoming scattered in the eastern mountain zones during the day on Monday. Abundant lightning is expected over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County. Most other

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA...EAST CENTRAL WETZEL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mannington, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
